title: Tottenham make bid for Man United target Bryan Mbeumo
body_text:
Tottenham have dramatically entered the race for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo, submitting a substantial £70 million bid, according to The Mirror.
With fresh ambitions under new leadership, Spurs are scrambling to capitalise on the interest Manchester United have shown in the Cameroon international.
Tottenham’s sudden push follows the appointment of Thomas Frank, Mbeumo’s former manager at Brentford, as head coach at the club.
Tottenham make their move to sign Bryan Mbeumo
Spurs have opened negotiations with Brentford, banking on Frank’s influence and established rapport with Mbeumo to seal the deal.
The club has reportedly tabled a lucrative £70 million offer, significantly above Man United’s earlier £60 million valuation
The 25‑year‑old attacker enjoyed an impressive season at Brentford, notching up 20 Premier League goals with an additional seven assists.
While United flirt with a mega‑salary, Tottenham aim to outshine with footballing vision, Champions League action under Frank’s leadership at the club.
The Red Devils were believed to be leading the race to sign the Brentford attacker.
However, that could change soon with Spurs looking to hijack the deal to strengthen their attack this summer.
Spurs and Man United are locked in a transfer battle
Champions League football, and the financial incentives that come with it, have given the North London club confidence to seal the deal for the Cameroon star.
Mbeumo has a big decision to make now with two of the biggest Premier League clubs chasing him.
The familiarity with Frank and the chance to play Champions League football would be a wise decision from the player but the lure of playing for Man United and the chance to become a part of their revival offers another kind of attraction.
Either way, he is edging closer to leave Brentford this summer to start a new chapter in his career.
